code: phi <- seq(500, 1700, length.out = 20) my_est <- SDALGCPMCML(data=data, formula=FORM, my_shp=PBCshp, delta=200, phi=phi, method=1, pop_shp=pop_den,                        weighted=TRUE, par0=NULL, control.mcmc=NULL) summary(my_est) #and for confidence interval use confint(my_est) phiCI(my_est, coverage = 0.95, plot = TRUE) Dis_pred <- SDALGCPPred(para_est=my_est,  continuous=FALSE) #to map the incidence plot(Dis_pred, type="incidence", continuous = FALSE) #and its standard error plot(Dis_pred, type="SEincidence", continuous = FALSE) #to map the covariate adjusted relative risk plot(Dis_pred, type="CovAdjRelRisk", continuous = FALSE) #and its standard error plot(Dis_pred, type="SECovAdjRelRisk", continuous = FALSE) #to map the exceedance probability that the covariate-adjusted relative risk is greter than a particular threshold plot(Dis_pred, type="CovAdjRelRisk", continuous = FALSE, thresholds=3.0) Con_pred <- SDALGCPPred(para_est=my_est, cellsize = 300, continuous=TRUE) #to map the covariate adjusted relative risk plot(Con_pred, type="relrisk") #and its standard error plot(Con_pred, type="SErelrisk") #to map the exceedance probability that the relative risk is greter than a particular threshold plot(Con_pred, type="relrisk", thresholds=1.5)

what: Spatio-temporal SDALGCP: application to Lung cancer mortality in Ohio.
title: A Spatially Discrete Approximation to Log-Gaussian Cox Processes for Modelling Aggregated Disease Count Data
text: Download dataset create spacetime object input spatio-temporal SDALGCP model Plot spatio-temporal count data Parameter estimation Area-level spatio-temporal prediction Ploting area-level incidence covariate adjusted relative risk Spatially continuous prediction covariate adjusted relative risk Ploting spatially continuous covariate-adjusted relative risk #Discussion Using SDALGCP package analysis spatially aggregated data provides two main advantages. One, allows user make spatially continous inference irrespective level aggregation data. Second, computationally efficient lgcp model aggregated data implemented package.
code: require(rgdal) require(sp) require(spacetime) ohiorespMort <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/olatunjijohnson/dataset/master/OhioRespMort.csv") download.file("https://github.com/olatunjijohnson/dataset/raw/master/ohio_shapefile.zip", "ohio_shapefile.zip") unzip("ohio_shapefile.zip") ohio_shp <- rgdal::readOGR("ohio_shapefile/","tl_2010_39_county00") ohio_shp <- sp::spTransform(ohio_shp, sp::CRS("+init=epsg:32617")) m <- length(ohio_shp) TT <- 21 Y <- ohiorespMort$y X <- ohiorespMort$year pop <- ohiorespMort$n E <- ohiorespMort$E data <- data.frame(Y=Y, X=X, pop=pop, E=E) formula <- Y ~  X + offset(log(E)) phi <- seq(10, 300, length.out = 10) control.mcmc <- controlmcmcSDA(n.sim=10000, burnin=2000, thin=80, h=1.65/((m*TT)^(1/6)), c1.h=0.01, c2.h=0.0001) time <- as.POSIXct(paste(1968:1988, "-01-01", sep = ""), tz = "") st_data <- spacetime::STFDF(sp = ohio_shp, time = time, data = data) spacetime::stplot(st_data[,,"Y"]) model.fit <- SDALGCPMCML_ST(formula=formula, st_data = st_data,  delta=800,                              phi=phi, method=2, pop_shp=NULL,  kappa=0.5,                             weighted=FALSE, par0=NULL, control.mcmc=control.mcmc,                              plot=TRUE, plot_profile=TRUE, rho=NULL,                             giveup=50, messages=TRUE) summary(model.fit) dis_pred <- SDALGCPPred_ST(para_est = model.fit, continuous = FALSE) plot(dis_pred, type="CovAdjRelRisk", main="Relative Risk", continuous=FALSE) plot(dis_pred,  type="incidence", main="Incidence", continuous=FALSE) con_pred <- SDALGCPPred_ST(para_est = model.fit, cellsize = 2500, continuous=TRUE, n.window = 1) plot(con_pred, type="relrisk", continuous=TRUE)

text: Download dataset create spacetime object input spatio-temporal SDALGCP model Plot spatio-temporal count data Parameter estimation Area-level spatio-temporal prediction Ploting area-level incidence covariate adjusted relative risk Spatially continuous prediction covariate adjusted relative risk Ploting spatially continuous covariate-adjusted relative risk
code: library(sf)  # Read CSV ohiorespMort <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/olatunjijohnson/dataset/master/OhioRespMort.csv")  # Download and unzip shapefile download.file("https://github.com/olatunjijohnson/dataset/raw/master/ohio_shapefile.zip",                destfile = "ohio_shapefile.zip") unzip("ohio_shapefile.zip")  # Read shapefile directly with sf ohio_shp <- sf::st_read("ohio_shapefile/tl_2010_39_county00.shp")  # Reproject to EPSG:32617 ohio_shp <- sf::st_transform(ohio_shp, 32617) library(dplyr)  # --- Join attributes --- # Merge data with shapefile by county name and year ohio_sf <- ohiorespMort %>%   left_join(ohio_shp, by = c("NAME" = "NAME00")) %>%   st_as_sf()  # convert to sf  # --- Add time column as Date --- ohio_sf <- ohio_sf %>%   mutate(time = as.Date(paste0(year + 1967, "-01-01"))) spacetime::stplot(st_data[,,"Y"]) m <- nrow(ohio_shp) TT <- nrow(ohio_sf)/m formula <- y ~ year + offset(log(E)) phi <- seq(10, 300, length.out = 10) control.mcmc <- list(n.sim=10000, burnin=2000, thin=80, h=1.65/((m*TT)^(1/6)), c1.h=0.01, c2.h=0.0001) model.fit <- SDALGCPMCML_ST(formula=formula, st_data = ohio_sf,  delta=1200,                              phi=phi, method=2, pop_shp=NULL,  kappa=0.5,                             weighted=FALSE, par0=NULL, control.mcmc=control.mcmc,                              plot=TRUE, plot_profile=TRUE, rho=NULL,                             giveup=50, messages=TRUE) summary(model.fit) dis_pred <- SDALGCPPred_ST(para_est = model.fit, continuous = FALSE) plot(dis_pred, type="CovAdjRelRisk", main="Relative Risk", continuous=FALSE) plot(dis_pred,  type="incidence", main="Incidence", continuous=FALSE) con_pred <- SDALGCPPred_ST(para_est = model.fit, cellsize = 2500, continuous=TRUE, n.window = 1) plot(con_pred, type="relrisk", continuous=TRUE)

title: SDALGCP: Spatially Discrete Approximation to Log-Gaussian Cox Processes ‚Äî SDALGCP-package
text: SDALGCP package provides tools continuous spatial spatio-temporal inference using spatially aggregated disease count data. implements computationally efficient approximation log-Gaussian Cox process (LGCP) model using Monte Carlo Maximum Likelihood (MCML).

title: SDALGCP: Spatially Discrete Approximation to Log-Gaussian Cox Processes ‚Äî SDALGCP-package
text: package includes functionality model fitting prediction: SDALGCPMCML estimates model parameters using MCML spatial data. SDALGCPPred performs spatial prediction (discrete continuous) fitted models. SDALGCPMCML_ST extends MCML approach spatio-temporal data. SDALGCPPred_ST provides prediction spatio-temporal settings. Additional methods include summary, print, confint model interpretation.

title: Create Candidate Sampling Points for SDA-LGCP Models ‚Äî SDALGCPCreatePoint
text: Generates spatial point samples (candidate locations) within polygonal study region use spatial statistical models. function supports `sf` polygon formats allows different point generation strategies: Simple Sequential Inhibition (SSI), uniform random sampling, regular grid.

title: Create Candidate Sampling Points for SDA-LGCP Models ‚Äî SDALGCPCreatePoint
code: SDALGCPCreatePoint(   my_shp,   delta,   weighted = FALSE,   lambdamax = NULL,   pop = NULL,   pop_shp = NULL,   n = NULL,   method = 1,   plot = FALSE,   rho = NULL,   giveup = NULL )

title: Create Candidate Sampling Points for SDA-LGCP Models ‚Äî SDALGCPCreatePoint
text: my_shp `sf` object geometry type `POLYGON` `MULTIPOLYGON`, representing study region. delta positive numeric value indicating point spacing (regular grid minimum distance SSI). weighted Logical; `TRUE`, population-weighted sampling used (relevant `pop` `pop_shp` supplied). lambdamax Optional; maximum intensity Poisson process rejection sampling. pop Optional; numeric vector population weights associated region. pop_shp Optional; raster layer population density support weighted sampling. n Optional; number points generate (used uniform regular grid methods). method integer indicating point generation method: 1 = Simple Sequential Inhibition (SSI), 2 = Uniform sampling, 3 = Regular grid. Default 1. plot Logical; `TRUE`, generated point pattern plotted region. Default `FALSE`. rho Optional; packing density SSI point process. Default `NULL`. giveup Optional; number failed attempts SSI sampling stops. Default `NULL`.

title: Create Candidate Sampling Points for SDA-LGCP Models ‚Äî SDALGCPCreatePoint
text: list following elements: xy matrix coordinates (x, y) sampled points. n Number sampled points. bound union study region polygons, returned `sf` object.

title: Create Candidate Sampling Points for SDA-LGCP Models ‚Äî SDALGCPCreatePoint
text: function primarily used internally within `SDALGCP` framework generate candidate spatial locations inside study region. Available point generation methods include: Simple Sequential Inhibition via SDALGCPSSIPoint Uniform random sampling via SDALGCPUniformPoint Regular grid via SDALGCPRegularPoint plotting enabled, function uses `spatstat.geom::.owin()` convert boundary plotting.

title: Parameter Estimation for SDA-LGCP Using Monte Carlo Maximum Likelihood ‚Äî SDALGCPMCML
text: formula formula describing fixed effects structure model (e.g., cases ~ covariate1 + offset(log(pop))). data data frame containing variables used model. my_shp `sf`, `SpatialPolygons`, `SpatialPolygonsDataFrame` object defining study region polygons. delta numeric value controlling spatial resolution polygon sampling (e.g., spacing points). phi Optional numeric vector spatial range (scale) parameters evaluate optimization. NULL, defaults sequence based spatial extent. method Integer indicating sampling method: 1 = Simple Sequential Inhibition (default), 2 = Uniform random, 3 = Regular grid. pop_shp Optional population raster (e.g., `terra` `raster`) used population-weighted point sampling. weighted Logical; TRUE, candidate point sampling weighted pop_shp. Default FALSE. par0 Optional numeric vector initial values: c(beta coefficients, sigma^2, phi). control.mcmc list MCMC settings created using controlmcmcSDA. plot Logical; TRUE, sampled points visualized. Default FALSE. plot_profile Logical; TRUE, profile likelihood phi plotted. Default TRUE. rho Packing density SSI sampling (method 1). Default NULL. giveup Maximum number failed point insertions SSI stops. Default NULL. messages Logical; TRUE, estimation progress printed. Default FALSE.

title: Parameter Estimation for SDA-LGCP Using Monte Carlo Maximum Likelihood ‚Äî SDALGCPMCML
text: object class "SDALGCP" components: D Design matrix fixed effects. y Response variable (counts). m Offset vector (e.g., population). beta_opt Estimated fixed effect coefficients. sigma2_opt Estimated process variance. phi_opt Estimated spatial scale parameter. cov Covariance matrix estimated parameters. Sigma_mat_opt Covariance matrix optimal parameters. llike_val_opt Maximum log-likelihood value. mu Fitted linear predictor values. all_para Parameter estimates across phi values. all_cov Covariance matrices across phi values. par0 Initial values used optimization. control.mcmc MCMC control settings used. call original function call.

title: Parameter Estimation for SDA-LGCP Using Monte Carlo Maximum Likelihood ‚Äî SDALGCPMCML
text: function implements spatially discrete approximation LGCP models proposed Christensen (2004) Giorgi & Diggle (2017), estimating latent Gaussian process fixed effects using MCML. approach involves: Generating candidate locations within polygon. Precomputing correlation matrices candidate points grid phi values. Performing likelihood-based parameter estimation using Langevin-Hastings MCMC.

title: Parameter Estimation for SDA-LGCP Using Monte Carlo Maximum Likelihood ‚Äî SDALGCPMCML
code: data(PBCshp) df <- as.data.frame(PBCshp@data) FORM <- X ~ propmale + Income + Employment + Education + Barriers + Crime +            Environment + offset(log(pop)) phi_vals <- seq(500, 1700, length.out = 5) glm_mod <- glm(FORM, family = poisson, data = df) par0 <- c(coef(glm_mod), mean(residuals(glm_mod)^2), median(phi_vals)) control.mcmc <- controlmcmcSDA(n.sim = 10000, burnin = 2000, thin = 8,                                h = 1.65/(545^(1/6)), c1.h = 0.01, c2.h = 1e-4)

title: Parameter estimation for spatio-temporal SDA-LGCP Using Monte Carlo Maximum likelihood ‚Äî SDALGCPMCML_ST
text: formula object class formula (one can coerced class): symbolic description model fitted. st_data data frame containing variables model polygons region, class spacetime. delta distance points phi discretised values scale parameter phi. supplied, uses default, 20 phis' ranges size smallest region one-tenth size entire domain. method specify method use sample points, options 1 Simple Sequential Inhibition (SSI) process, 2 Uniform sampling 3 regular grid. 1 default pop_shp Optional, raster population density map population weighted approach kappa smoothness parameter matern correlation function assumed temporal correlation, default 0.5 corresponds exponential correlation function. weighted specify want use population density, default FALSE, .e population density used. par0 initial parameter fixed effects beta, variance sigmasq scale parameter phi, specified c(beta, sigma2, phi). Default; beta, estimates glm; sigma2, variance residual; phi, median supplied phi. control.mcmc list controlmcmcSDA define burnin, thining, number iteration turning parameters see controlmcmcSDA. plot display plot points inside polygon, default TRUE plot_profile logical; TRUE profile-likelihood plotted. default FALSE rho Optional, packing density, default set 0.55 giveup Optional, number rejected proposals algorithm terminate, default set 1000 messages logical; messages=TRUE, prints results objective function parameters every phi iteration. Default FALSE.

title: Parameter estimation for spatio-temporal SDA-LGCP Using Monte Carlo Maximum likelihood ‚Äî SDALGCPMCML_ST
text: object class "SDALGCP". function summary.SDALGCPST used print summary fitted model. object list following components: D: matrix covariates. y: count, response observations. m: offset beta_opt: estimates fixed effects model. sigma2_opt: estimates variance Gaussian process. phi_opt: estimates scale parameter phi Gaussian process. cov: covariance matrix MCML estimates. Sigma_mat_opt: covariance matrix Gaussian process corresponds optimal value llike_val_opt: maximum value log-likelihood. mu: mean linear predictor all_para: entire estimates different values phi. all_cov: entire covariance matrix estimates different values phi. par0: initial parameter fixed effects beta variance sigmasq used estimation control.mcmc: burnin, thining, number iteration turning parameters used see controlmcmcSDA. call: matched call.

title: Parameter estimation for spatio-temporal SDA-LGCP Using Monte Carlo Maximum likelihood ‚Äî SDALGCPMCML_ST
text: function performs parameter estimation SDALGCP Model Monte Carlo Maximum likelihood. Monte Carlo maximum likelihood method uses conditional simulation distribution random effect \(T(x) = d(x)'\beta+S(x)\) given data y, order approximate high-dimensional intractable integral given likelihood function. resulting approximation likelihood maximized numerical optimization algorithm uses analytic expression computation gradient vector Hessian matrix. functions used numerical optimization nlminb. first stage estimation generating locations inside polygon, followed precomputing correlation matrices, optimising likelihood.

title: Precompute Correlation Matrices for Spatial Regions ‚Äî precomputeCorrMatrix

text: list containing: R array dimension [n_regions, n_regions, length(phi)] containing correlation matrices. phi input vector spatial scale parameters.

title: Precompute Correlation Matrices for Spatial Regions ‚Äî precomputeCorrMatrix
text: function uses exponential correlation function: $$\mathrm{Corr}(d) = \exp(-d / \phi)$$ \(d\) Euclidean distance points \(\phi\) spatial scale parameter. weighted = TRUE, function computes correlations weighted sums using product weights exponential kernel values. Otherwise, uses unweighted averages.
